DOC.brief_summary: This is a Phase I, multicenter, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study that will be conducted in the United States and consists of a single ascending-dose stage followed by a multidose, parallel-treatment stage. This study will be conducted in approximately 50 adult patients between 50-85 years old who have mild to moderate Alzheimer's disease.
DOC.brief_title: A Study of the Safety, Pharmacokinetics, Pharmacodynamics, and Immunogenicity of Anti-Abeta (MABT5102A) in Patients With Alzheimer's Disease
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis of probable AD according to the NINCDSADRDA Criteria Approved AD treatments (AchE inhibitors+/memantine) must be stable for ≥ 3 months prior to screening Other prescription medications must be stable for ≥ 1 month prior to screening Female patients with reproductive potential History or presence of any clinically significant CNS disease History of treatment with any protein therapeutic targeting Abeta
